fields.summary: Ceph snapshots created earlier than 4.4 cannot be fully deleted in 4.4

comments.body: [~ccassler] please keep an eye on this case when doing upgrade testing. If there is a need to delete snapshots as part of upgrade we can identify them.
I attempted an upgrade with a ceph enabled cloud.   The eucalyptus-cloud service was removed during the upgrade.  I filed EUCA-13139 to cover that issue.

I'm seeing these messages regarding RBD in the logs after the upgrade:

I verified the message appears exactly as described in the ticket and identifies the correct snapshot after it is deleted.
[~ccassler], what is the process to manually delete the snapshot data?

[~ccassler]: It seems the cleaner-upper is being passed a Ceph snapshot point ID that it can't parse. It should be in the form "pool/image@snapshot", e.g. {{eucaqa_vol/vol-72ea8b83@snap-f36046f5}}, but apparently it's not getting the pool or image (we know it has the snapshot). Next time you get there, could you look for this statement and log the result here? and compress/attach the cloud-debug.log so i can see what's around it? (or sosreport but that's the only file I need)
Thanks!

{noformat}
    LOG.info("Deleting snapshot snapshotId=" + snapshotId + ", snapshotIqn=" + snapshotIqn + ", snapshotPointId=" + snapshotPointId);
{noformat}

That's probably why it has to be done manually. The above rbd command would also need all 3 pieces of info (pool, image, and snapshot). Here, image == Euca volume ID.

The user should know the pool name, but if not, let's assume she can search all the available pools. For each one, she could:

{noformat}
# rbd --id qauser --keyring /etc/ceph/ceph.client.qauser.keyring info eucaqa_snap/snap-c5bb85ce
rbd image 'snap-c5bb85ce':
        size 1024 MB in 256 objects
        order 22 (4096 kB objects)
        block_name_prefix: rbd_data.3736205bb456ab
        format: 2
        features: layering
        flags:
        parent: eucaqa_vol/vol-1c77102b@sp-for-snap-c5bb85ce
        overlap: 1024 MB
{noformat}

Then, knowing the image name {{vol-85afef71}}, she could delete the snapshot image, and the snapshot of the parent image, with other rbd commands:

{noformat}
# rbd --id qauser --keyring /etc/ceph/ceph.client.qauser.keyring snap ls eucaqa_snap/snap-c5bb85ce
SNAPID NAME                   SIZE
  6060 sp-on-snap-c5bb85ce 1024 MB

# rbd --id qauser --keyring /etc/ceph/ceph.client.qauser.keyring snap unprotect eucaqa_snap/snap-c5bb85ce@sp-on-snap-c5bb85ce

# rbd --id qauser --keyring /etc/ceph/ceph.client.qauser.keyring snap rm eucaqa_snap/snap-c5bb85ce@sp-on-snap-c5bb85ce

# rbd --id qauser --keyring /etc/ceph/ceph.client.qauser.keyring rm eucaqa_snap/snap-c5bb85ce
Removing image: 100% complete...done.

# rbd --id qauser --keyring /etc/ceph/ceph.client.qauser.keyring snap unprotect eucaqa_vol/vol-1c77102b@sp-for-snap-c5bb85ce

# rbd --id qauser --keyring /etc/ceph/ceph.client.qauser.keyring snap rm eucaqa_vol/vol-1c77102b@sp-for-snap-c5bb85ce
{noformat}

If Euca knows the pool name, then it could delete the snapshot itself following the same process, which is why I want to see that snapshotPointId. If no pool name, then we're out of luck and it really does have to be deleted manually, using the above steps. (The rbd command in the previous comment was just to delete the original Ceph snapshot, not the subsequent cloned image and the snapshot of that cloned image, which might also still exist.)
Thanks [~lincoln.thomas].  I will try this out today and update the ticket with the results.

[~lincoln.thomas]: This is what I found in the logs when grepping for the info you supplied above.  I also attached the cloud-debug.log file to this bug.
{code}
Mon Jan 23 21:54:13 2017 DEBUG [SnapshotDeleter:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-282] Deleting snapshot snap-617ac946 from EBS backend...
Mon Jan 23 21:54:13 2017  INFO [CephRbdProvider:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-282] Deleting snapshot snapshotId=snap-617ac946, snapshotIqn=eucaqa_snap/snap-617ac946,eucaqa_snap/snap-617ac946, snapshotPointId=null
Mon Jan 23 21:54:13 2017 DEBUG [SnapshotDeleter:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-282] Deleting snapshot snap-617ac946 from ObjectStorageGateway
Mon Jan 23 21:54:14 2017 DEBUG [S3SnapshotTransfer:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-282] Deleting snapshot from objectstorage: snapshotId=snap-617ac946, bucket=snapshots-58177a6dc2dd4062a28856a217291460, key=snap-617ac946
{code} [^cloud-debug.log.gz]
[~lincoln.thomas], I linked the possibly related EUCA-12857 ticket to this issue.

Decision in today's bug scrub was to create a script that can be run during the 4.4.0 upgrade (and separately on-demand): For all snapshots in the Euca DB where snaphotPointId is null, populate it from Ceph info calls on those snapshots. All snapshots created in 4.3.x and earlier will not have the snaphotPointId populated until this script runs. This will allow any snapshot deletion to work correctly in 4.4.0 or later, regardless of what release created it.

Working on it...
Upgrade script coded, in testing...

Fixed by adding Groovy script {{tools/PopulateSnapPoints.groovy}} to be run at the time of upgrade from v4.3.x to v4.4.x, on each SC host. It can also be run manually. Looks for missing {{snapshot_point_id}} fields in the {{snapshots}} table and populates them by searching for the snapshots' parent volumes in the Ceph pools. Allows those pre-4.4 snaps to be deleted normally by "euca-delete-snapshot" or eucaconsole.

See file comment header for details/usage.

See pull request https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/pull/92

Commit e3b725855a7e9dfcccfd4a0be2c599872f983013 into maint-4.4

After IRC discussion with the team today, I'll be moving the script from {{tools}} into {{clc/modules/block-storage/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/blockstorage/PopulateSnapPoints.groovy}}, run it from the SC's init code, and also place it in {{/usr/share/eucalyptus}} for users to run it manually if needed after the upgrade.

Now integrated into source tree.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/pull/93 (source updates)

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/pull/94  ('make install' update)

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-rpmspec/pull/21 (rpmspec update to install script to /usr/share/eucalyptus in the rare case that the cloud admin has to run it manually)
[~gholms] I only need you to review and merge the rpmspec update, not expecting you to review the source code. Thanks.
Merged.

I created various snapshots in 4.3.  I then deleted the snapshots in 4.4.  Some snapshots were deleted immediately, others were marked for deletion and then deleted after parent images were cleared.  Output from cloud-debug.log
{code}
[root@d-09 ~]# tail -F /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log | grep snap-f156fe55
Fri Feb 17 17:32:53 2017  INFO [BlockStorageController:eucalyptus-bootstrap-servicecontext-common-worker-644] Processing DeleteStorageSnapshot request for snapshot snap-f156fe55

Fri Feb 17 17:33:05 2017  INFO [CephRbdProvider:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-359] Deleting snapshot snapshotId=snap-f156fe55, snapshotIqn=eucaqa_snap/snap-f156fe55,eucaqa_snap/snap-f156fe55, snapshotPointId=eucaqa_vol/vol-4f8788be@sp-for-snap-f156fe55
Fri Feb 17 17:33:05 2017 DEBUG [SnapshotDeleter:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-359] Snapshot snap-f156fe55 set to 'deletedfromebs' state from EBS cleanup
Fri Feb 17 17:33:05 2017 DEBUG [SnapshotDeleter:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-359] Snapshot snap-f156fe55 was marked for deletion from OSG. Evaluating prerequistes for cleanup...
Fri Feb 17 17:33:05 2017 DEBUG [SnapshotDeleter:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-359] Snapshot snap-f156fe55 may have been created prior to incremental snapshot support
Fri Feb 17 17:33:05 2017 DEBUG [SnapshotDeleter:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-359] Deleting snapshot snap-f156fe55 from ObjectStorageGateway
Fri Feb 17 17:33:05 2017 DEBUG [S3SnapshotTransfer:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-359] Deleting snapshot from objectstorage: snapshotId=snap-f156fe55, bucket=snapshots-d6a490a1345d4ecbb36ce48f4f0331ca, key=snap-f156fe55
Fri Feb 17 17:33:05 2017 DEBUG [SnapshotDeleter:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-359] Setting snapshot snap-f156fe55 to 'deleted' state from OSG cleanup

Fri Feb 17 17:34:05 2017  INFO [CephRbdFormatTwoAdapter:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-359] Removing snapshot=sp-on-snap-f156fe55, image=snap-f156fe55, pool=eucaqa_snap
Fri Feb 17 17:34:06 2017  INFO [CephRbdFormatTwoAdapter:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-359] Deleting image=snap-f156fe55, pool=eucaqa_snap
Fri Feb 17 17:34:14 2017 DEBUG [CephRbdFormatTwoAdapter:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-359] RBD snapshot=sp-for-snap-f156fe55, image=vol-4f8788be, pool=eucaqa_vol marked for deletion, trying to clean it up
Fri Feb 17 17:34:14 2017  INFO [CephRbdFormatTwoAdapter:eucalyptus-storage-checkerthreadpool-worker-359] Removing RBD snapshot=sp-for-snap-f156fe55, image=vol-4f8788be, pool=eucaqa_vol

Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
